nodes.bodyText: Perhaps we can move this "mapping" inside mapping class/utility and produce it with mapstruct?
Should we filter out one-switch flows here?

Possible NPE here - chances are low but still exists. If there is a "corrupter" flow in DB with only 1 path in one direction - and there is only one such flow for this switch - NPE will arrive here (and for reverse/false side too).
Abstract bolt already does this (with the only difference - it will add "Unhandled exception prefix" to the log message).
Why there is no headers(correlation-id) here?
in groovy can be just def server42switchesDpIds = server42switches*.dpId

nodes.bodyText:
Since we can still run tests on topologies without server42 it is not guaranteed to find such switchPair. Then the result of 'find' method will be null. After such switch-searching operations we usually do an 'assumption'
assumeTrue("Was not able to find a switch with a server42 connected", switchPair != null)

If assumption is not satisfied the test will be marked as 'skipped'
